pros: Friendly atmosphere. Flexible hours. Rewarding experience.
cons: Poor pay and status. Needs better pay and conditions.

review_title: Small housing association with budget/managerial problems seeking restructuring at great cost to staff and tenants.
job_title: Customer Service Officer in Southend-on-Sea, England
pros: Fair pay (even increased it during redundancy process so question prudence and planning!!) Friendly and hard working customer service team
cons:
An Executive Team that are so far removed from the workforce, they are unable to see how the business works. The tenants are treated with disregard. Repairs and maintenance are shocking.  Estuary seem to take on people every time there is a ‘new idea’ and then make them redundant without hesitation or awareness of the stress and disruption this causes to all.
This does not seem to be a secure organisation. Budget struggles, new ideas every short while. Doesn’t listen to its staff.  Daily ICT problems whether in office or working remotely at home. 
An HR team who do not know and never seem to meet the staff. It seems they are wheeled out to deal with redundancy only.
A lot of issues with management

pros: The company did not know what they were doing. Manager was clueless.
cons: Everything. The pay, no training, left to figure it out on own. No support!

pros:
Convenient if you live in Essex. 
Doing some great work in Essex and East London providing a great service to vulnerable people. 
Knowing you are providing a valuable service to those in need. 
There are some great people who work here and are really an asset to the company and the tenants we serve. 
The tenants! Some are such lovely people.
cons:
Very dated place to work, no attraction for new staff or existing staff members to stay. 
Lack of willingness to change or modernize. Held back by 'some' managers and staff who have worked here for 15/20 years + as 'some' have a unwillingness to change 
Divide between staff and management. 
A sense of unwillingness to change
No social benefits or social culture
No progression opportunities or meaningful investment in staff. 
Huge reliance of agencies to hire staff, existing employees overlooked.
Lack of communication internally. 
No benefits within post and agile/flexible working is discouraged. 
Lack of culture within the company, isolated from other departments
Staff are not consulted with, regarding organisation changes/decisions and are told once decisions have been made, even if they have grave effects on individuals.

pros: Some really good staff here with some real team spirit. Management are approachable at all levels which does help. Good location and lots of new stock.
cons: Very dated in its procedures and needs to radically modernise. Too much time spent printing out useless bits of paper for the sake of it.

pros: Nice people to work with who generally care about their customer base and providing a service.
cons: Can be constricted at times on their ways of working and somewhat dated working practises. There was and needs to be an effort to modernise.

job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Southend-on-Sea, England
pros: Not bad rates of pay, local and easy to get to, nice staff
cons: No room for progression, lots of paperwork and politics
